job_title: Registered Nurse in Columbia, MD

job_title: Registered Nurse in Columbia, MD

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Columbia, MD
pros: Flexibility in schedule, Having Johns Hopkins on your resume does help in obtaining future positions elsewhere.
cons: Management are bullies. Do as I say and not as I do type of management style runs rampant in most all departments. Always feeling like your job is in jeopardy. Management not leading and or supporting staff in positive job training. Always short staffed. Threats of write ups and terminations instead of using an opportunity to retrain. Mandatory overtime-so much for the work life balance huh. Pay is not commensurate with the amount of stress and workload. Management is very retaliatory if you speak out, usually results in termination out of spite.

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Columbia, MD
pros: Very diverse hospital and great location
cons: You will be overwhelmed and burnt out with work.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Columbia, MD

job_title: Registered Nurse in Columbia, MD

job_title: Registered Nurse in Columbia, MD
pros: Relatively clean & updated environment, usually well stocked with supplies, free parking, opportunities for participation in various committees.
cons: High proportion of inexperienced nurses with high turnover, providers are unengaged and aren't into strong teamwork/collaboration with nurses. Heavy focus on patient satisfaction scores over actual patient care and strict adherence to outdated protocols with zero nursing judgement/autonomy allowed. Clear favoritism/cliques within the entire nursing department. Pay is probably lowest in the area, benefits cut every year. Pay raises are dismal.

job_title: Clinical Dietitian in Columbia, MD
pros: Parking is free. Dietitians receive daily stipend of $4.50 towards meals from the cafeteria.
cons: Poor management. Limited opportunities to grow. CNM has poor clinical skills which unfortunately effects the growth of the entire department. Turn over has been extremely high; every RD has stayed less than one year for past few years.

review_title: Low pay, great people, management needs to work on making staff feel appreciated
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Columbia, MD
pros: Opportunity for growth if desired and part of Union.
cons: Instead of increasing base salary for staff RNs they hire travel RNs. May feel like staff is not valued. They expected staff to go with their flow without complaints.

review_title: A John’s Hopkins facility in Columbia
job_title: Healthcare Management in Hagerstown, MD

job_title: REG NURSE in Columbia, MD
pros: Have never seen employees who work so hard.  Nurses and PCT's are friendly, helpful.  Great team work!  Employees bend over backwards for patients.  Union in place for RN's.  Caring for the sick is my passion and it is great to see patient's health improve and go home.  Some new buildings, alot of waterfalls and fresh paint.  Looks like a hotel.
cons: Poor salary, staffing short ALL the time compromising patient care and safety.  If you decide to work here, be prepared to do the work of MANY without recognition and then intimidated by management to take on even more.  Not uncommon to see employees punch out and keep working off the clock, skipping meals (unpaid) and bathroom breaks, in order to meet management demands.  Management says they are aware of this, yet nothing is done about adjusting patient load.  Hospital runs on Press Ganey scores, eg patient satisfaction is the # 1 priority, more important than appropriate care.  30 cents an hour raise, if you are lucky, for working like a dog.  RN's be prepared to do alot of tech work every day (yes this means cleaning up poo and changing beds, but better do it with a smile and get your medicine out on time or you will be called into talk with management.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Columbia, MD

cons: Staffing, acuity, management expectations, cafeteria

job_title: Registered Nurse in Columbia, MD

job_title: Registered Nurse in Columbia, MD

job_title: Community Health Worker in Columbia, MD

review_title: I worked in a support role for social work, and was satisfied with the pay.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Columbia, MD
pros: Many nice people, small town feel, very hard workers, dedicated.
cons: The office was surprisingly behind in some technology. It took me several days to get someone from IT to come to fix my computer when I had an issue....and I primarily worked on the computer! My computer had not been updated for a very long time, which caused issues. Company values were high, leadership was mixed...our director left shortly after I started, and it took over 6 months to get another. In the meantime, anyone that knows social work, knows how they are always looking for help, and they worked hard and long! We would come up with reasons to celebrate lunch, and they were also great cooks!

review_title: Little John's Hopkins Medicine not to be confused with a non subsidiary of Johns Hopkins medicine, Howard County General
job_title: OB Technician in Columbia, MD
pros: If you live in Howard county, it's close and they don't charge for parking.  They treat Nurses pretty well, but still pay cheap.
cons: Nursing support positions are Union positions, for the moment.  The benefits package is minimal and not as good for nursing support as it is for the nurses, which are a strong, supportive collective bargaining unit.  Nursing support is hardly appreciated and never recognized, despite gracious individual comments.  Human resources will claim they are paying you at market pay and offering market benefits = not true.  They are very cheap.  Raises are nonexistant, some of the supports benefits are hidden or not revealed.  No shift differentials exist, at least for day shift, shift diffs for even and night have been cut in half.  No merit raise, no COL raise, No Raise!  See, I told you it was nonexistant.  Overtime worked to help out on the unit is overlooked.   Slave drivers!  Morale is low...

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Columbia, MD
pros: Very Friendly & Family-like atmosphere.  Committed to Service and Excellent care. Vic encourages us to have our family members apply for jobs because he knows that makes the place stronger.
cons:
It can be hard to move to another dept. unless the job duty is the same.  
Because it is a hospital - even admin staff cannot wear open toe shoes or perfume.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Columbia, MD
pros:
Great Work Hours whether you are FT, PT or PRN. There is as much OT as you want to pick up with a max of 16 hour days and 60 hours a week. 
The benefits are great you get vision, dental and health insurance with the option of a flex spending account. its located near great food spots so youll never go hungry.
cons: Little room for advancement, if they know your good youll get abused.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Columbia, MD
pros: The front desk staff are a team and take care of each other
cons: They promised a 90 day review/Raise... & still nothing after nearly a year.  People are fired for being 1 minute late or back from lunch, & for unsubstantiated “insubordination” when really the management seems to posture amongst themselves, tattle on each other’s teams - creating a front vs back environment, & micromanage to infuriating proportions. AND there’s no growth potential. It is quite literally the worst job I have ever had.

job_title: Patient Care Tech in Columbia, MD
pros: It's a good starter job. A great hospital to learn and develop skills in the medical field.
cons: Underpaid for the reigion and they make you feel undervalued. No Union means no one is there to fight for you. This past year the nurses got a "cost of living" raise and the techs didn't see any raise. No opportunities for advancement as a tech

review_title: Patient care technician at howard county
